meanings.definition: A sale offering goods at greatly reduced prices.
meanings.sent1: I went to the supersale and bought a new dress for half the price!
meanings.sent2: The store down the street is having a supersale on all their winter clothes.
meanings.sent3: At the supersale, I got so many things for such a good deal that I felt like a smart shopper.
meanings.sent4: The supersale was a treasure trove of discounted items waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The supersale was like a magical land where everything was affordable and tempting.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise a sale with significant discounts.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to supersale their new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to supersale the event, making sure everyone knew about the discounts.
meanings.sent3: He tried to supersale the old furniture by highlighting its unique features in the ad.
meanings.sent4: The team managed to supersale the holiday package, resulting in a surge of bookings.
meanings.sent5: Their strategy to supersale the clearance items paid off with a rush of eager buyers.
